org.jtrim.cancel

Interface ChildCancellationSource

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CancellationSource

    public interface ChildCancellationSource
extends CancellationSource
    Defines a CancellationSource whose CancellationToken can also be canceled through a parent CancellationToken. That is, whenever the parent CancellationToken signals a cancellation request, the CancellationToken of the ChildCancellationSource will also signal cancellation request.

    When detecting cancellation request is no longer required, the ChildCancellationSource can be detached from the parent CancellationToken. Detaching from the parent CancellationToken allows to cleanup any resources required to be notified of the cancellation request of the parent CancellationToken. Usually this means, that a cancellation listener is unregistered from the parent CancellationToken.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this interface are required to be safely accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this interface are required to be synchronization transparent but note that the methods of the CancellationController and the CancellationSource are not.
    See Also:
    Cancellation.createCancellationSource()

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void detachFromParent()
      Detaches this ChildCancellationSource from its parent CancellationToken, so that cancellation requests of the parent token will no longer notify the CancellationToken of this ChildCancellationSource (i.e.: the token returned by getToken()).
      CancellationToken getParentToken()
      Returns the parent CancellationToken whose cancellation request is to be forwarded of the CancellationToken of this ChildCancellationSource (i.e.: the token returned by getToken()).

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jtrim.cancel.CancellationSource

        getController, getToken

    • Method Detail

      • getParentToken

        CancellationToken getParentToken()
        Returns the parent CancellationToken whose cancellation request is to be forwarded of the CancellationToken of this ChildCancellationSource (i.e.: the token returned by getToken()). Note that cancellation request is only forwarded until this ChildCancellationSource has been detached from the parent CancellationToken.

        This method can be used even after this ChildCancellationSource has been detached from the parent CancellationToken.

        Returns:
        the parent CancellationToken whose cancellation request is to be forwarded of the CancellationToken. This method never returns null.

      • detachFromParent

        void detachFromParent()
        Detaches this ChildCancellationSource from its parent CancellationToken, so that cancellation requests of the parent token will no longer notify the CancellationToken of this ChildCancellationSource (i.e.: the token returned by getToken()).

        Cancellation requests made to the parent CancellationToken will not affect this ChildCancellationSource after this method returns. Note that it is possible that prior or concurrent cancellation request of the parent CancellationToken will take effect only after this method returns. That is, cancellation listeners registered to the CancellationToken of this ChildCancellationSource may still be invoked after this method returns, even if this cancellation resulted from a cancellation request of the parent CancellationToken.
